original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares gain in mid day trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka‘s shares edged up in mid day trade on Thursday mainly pushed up by the banking and financial sectors, Colombo Stock Exchange data showed.
The main All Share Price Index (ASPI) was up 0.94 percent or 83.99 points to 8,976.6, while the most liquid index S&P SL20 was up 1.21 percent or 31.25 points to 2,619.88.
Sri Lanka’s public bank deposits and stability of the banking system will be safeguarded in any reorganization of domestic debt, the Central Bank Governor Nandalal Weerasinghe said.
“There is speculation about the stability of public deposits and banking system stability,” Governor Weerasinghe told in a public forum.
“In any kind of debt optimization, we will ensure and safeguard banking system stability as well as the protection of public deposits.”
A key objective of the central bank is maintaining financial sector stability, he said.
The market generated a turnover of 320 million rupees at 1200 hours.
Top gainers were Commercial Bank, NDB and DFCC Bank, during mid day trade. (Colombo/May11/2023)
